reviews.sentence: Nice hotel with a couple issues. Our experience at the Tuscan Inn was a good one nice surprise for a Best Western except for 2 important things. Although the room was updated and well appointed it was extremely small. The bathroom sink mirror was IN the bedroom no door and to use the light in the commode shower you also had turn on the light to the sink which illuminated the bedroom. Not nice in the middle of the night. The sink area and the actual toilet were dollhouse sized not possible to share the space. The air conditioner would shift into a very loud overdrive mode every 5 minutes or so again not nice while trying to sleep. The bed was super comfortable though.

Ok but do not waste your money upgrading to the suites. We arrived during the Dreamforce convention and had to pay TOP dollar. I booked a two room suite with a view and new furniture. The bedroom was pretty enough and the bed was comfortable. The street noise was always present we kept the AC fan on all night to mask the sounds. The livingrom was dismissal see photos. I asked to see other rooms and they were very similar. We never used the living room except to iron our close. The free cocktail hour was nice but got crowded. The staff were efficient but not really welcoming. Housekeeping did a good job keeping the room clean. I would not send my friends here.

Dated and badly needs modernisation. We stayed here for three nights and were disappointed by the experience the first room they gave us the window shutter when we opened it gave us a very high red brick wall directly in front of us when we explained we were not happy their first response was that it was a city hotel and not known for its views. She did move us but warned us it may be affected from the noise of the city this was clearly not true as she put us in a room directly overlooking another properties backyard. The ensuite was so small that the sink did not fit in it so it was in the room something I can only remember from ancient B B establishments in the past and I do not consider that acceptable in a hotel supposedly of this standard overall very disappointed.
good location not so comfortable room. a c in the room was very noisy. room was small and it definitely needs renovation.

Great Location. At the risk of sounding whiney the front desk could work on being more welcoming. We booked through AARP and I guess the hotel was a Best Western at one time. Our confirmation said Best Western The Tuscan. It was not a big deal but when looking for the hotel we looked for Best Western and the signage says only The Tuscan. When checking in I said that I had difficulty finding the hotel because I was looking for Best Western. The front desk lady looked at me like I was stupid and said is not our sign still located at the front of the hotel. I guess it was ignorant of me to not know that they were no longer Best Western. I felt like an idiot that she had to put up with rather than a welcome guest. It is just a small thing but it was my first impression and it stuck. Other staff were friendly and really after the initial contact the reception lady was friendly too. Maybe to be fair she was tired of hearing the same complaint or maybe she did not understand what I was saying. The location. Fishermans wharf was a short walk away. There was a grocery store close by as well as lots and lots of restaurants. The best thing about the hotel is the location. The hallways could use a fresh coat of paint but overall the hotel was in good repair.

Location location location. Close to everything. Stayed at The Tuscan Jan 17th21st and I have to say I was really impressed with the staff and the location of the hotel itself. When we first arrived around 10 am they did not make us wait to check in they had a room ready. We had come out to San Francisco for my birthday and to celebrate it the hotel sent up a bottle of champagne and a little chocolate cake. They could not have made me feel any more special. They are doing a renovation in the hotel and our water got shut off from 10 am to 5 pm which was not a big deal since you are outside all the time. The rooms are very small and the bathrooms even smaller. The room has a safe which we found to be helpful. The mini fridge was great too. If you do not have your room cleaned they give you a 5 a day credit towards your bill restaurant or mini bar purchase. There are plenty of stores around and great food options on the pier. Since San Francisco is known for being expensive this hotel was priced perfectly at least for when we went out the rainy season. I will be staying here anytime I come out and the only reason they did not get the ful5 was how small the rooms are.

Because of renovations we were not able to use the main entrance which meant we did not get to talk with their lovely staff. Having said that every time we saw them they were lovely. They must have been cold standing outside st the temporary desk. We did not hear any noise from the renovations. The bed was awesomely comfortable and overall a lovely place to stay.

Great location. Under renovation but did not disturb us. Wish we had tea coffee facility in the room though. It looked like it needed a good clean inside but again having renovations done so it might be part of it.

Not what was pictured on the website. We had no idea that the hotel was in the midst of renovations when we arrived. We entered in a side stairwell into a dark makeshift reception area. We were originally assigned a old un renovated room supplied with free earplugs to block the construction noise. After mentioning our disappointment to the staff we were moved to the last newly renovated room. It matched the photo but was not quite ready for use. The tub was still dirty from installation and some hardware was not yet fitted a phone was swapped over while we were relaxing in the room. Access to rooms from the street concerned us as a security issue. Anyone could walk into a lift from the outside drop off area directly up to the rooms without ever passing through reception or seeing a security guard. The staff was friendly and helpful. We were continually offered wine even an entire new bottle after having already had several glasses. It seemed as though it was offered to compensate for the state of the hotel but it just seemed inappropriate. It was a strange experience. The hotels location was good. Location Lots. Honesty in advertising. eg The hotel is currently undergoing renovations.

Not happy. We were not made aware that the hotel was under renovation when we booked or during the time before we arrived. There was NO lobby just a room being renovated. The staff was very polite and gave us a 100 food credit and took one days cost off our bill as we left. The rooms were very nice but noisy during the day from the work going on. The location was exactly what we wanted. But we felt that we should have been informed by the hotel and Hotelscom of the inconveniences that existed.

San Francisco trip. Rooms were recently renovated everything new was nice. Close to the activities we wanted to do in San Francisco. Parking was way to expensive. We had to pay 65 a night plus tax for a SUV. I had asked for a quiet room and ours faced a somewhat busy street lots of noise throughout the night kept us awake. Also beds were hard not compfy at all. Room was also on the small side.

Compact attractive well designed room. Pleasant stay. The hotel was going through the final stages of a major renovation during my visit so there were some minor hiccups but I can not complain. I believe I was the first person to stay in that particular room since it had been renovated so I was pleased as everything was new and fresh. The bed was comfortable and the room was well designed with a contemporary motif. If you are looking for close proximity to tourist attractions such as Fishermans Wharf this very well may be a good option for you. The hotel is located in an area that is mixed with a few other hotels but I had say it is mainly a residential area I found that somewhat charming as I typically stay downtown when visiting SF. Public transportation is easily accessible with street cars and busses within walking distance. The location does not personally work for me as I prefer to be close to BART and the noise of the city but it is definitely worth a visit if you are looking for a newly renovated property that is in a quiet neighborhood and within a hop skip and jump to the waterfront and touristy stuff.

Modern and Friendly. The hotel has been updated and is cozy with good Wi Fi and recharging units. Staff is very helpful and cheerful. The rooms are not large but comfortable. The location is great with most places within walking distance and is very close to the trolley. The parking locally is a challenge but the hotel will provide valet parking for a fee a little high but its SF so not outside the lines. The furniture and bed is very comfortable. The outside patio is great for relaxing. The hotel has a sense of class with a modern flair. I feel comfortable recommending this one.
Excellent renovation clean rooms they offer 10 per night in comp service if you turn down room service.

Newly renovated hotel on Fishermans Wharf. I have stayed at this hotel when it was Tuscan Inn. Now taken over and totally renovated. it is modern and eco friendly. Beautifully re decorated and very comfortable. Spacious rooms and well equipped with all amenities. Décor is very up to date with the style of today and very quiet. So close to all the sites Pier 39 cable cars and shopping. So glad I chose Hotel Zoe. Will be back. totally renovated modern. Eco friendly. Love the incentive to choose to suspend housekeeping giving me a little extra money to spend at Pescatore. Love it is close to the Wharf cable cars Shopping and restaurants.

Great Location updated hotel. HiI stayed at this hotel about 5 years ago when it was Best Western Tuscan we loved it and thought we would try it again. It is now Hotel Zoe The location is great a couple of blocks from the Wharf and Pier 39. The hotel has been updated at some time rooms comfortable and clean. They allowed us to check in early around 1 and the staff was efficient if not friendly. It was a bit disappointing that they did away with the evening wine social but now they give you a voucher for a specific glass of wine. There is a restaurant bar at the corner of the building which we did not try since the only thing on their posted menu were drinks and snacks but it was empty most of the time anyway Pescatore. we were there Saturday SundayThe location was great not only for the proximity to the Wharf but just around the corner is World Market Ross Trader Joes etc. Across the street is a Safeway grocery store along with some other shops including a pharmacy in a small shopping center kind of hidden. The area feels very safe even at night. I would recommend highly other than the price which was a bit on the high side.
Amazing stay recently renovated and super nice.

We liked the location and renewed property and rooms. Very friends and helpful staff along with a lovely lobby and outdoor space. The towels could be more lush since the property is so nice. We will return.
Beautiful revamped hotel very modern. Will definitely stay here again.

Conflicted good review. The location is very near Fisherman ’s Wharf. but when we asked the concierge where to go he only directed us to Pier 39. Pier 39 is loud commercial expensive gaudy touristy. We finally found the Piers where real good awaited us. Pier 41. When I queried the concierge he said that Pier 39 is where everyone wants to go. Also we wanted a tour he told us HIS tours ended at 5 pm but when we left the hotel at 7 pm we saw 2 tour buses still giving tours. Hotel is updated beds lovely. Coffee in the lobby no pots in rooms. Showers teeny tiny. Lobby music LOUD.
